```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| fig-align: center
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 8 
#| eval: true
#| fig-cap: A Barabasi-Albert preferential attachment network with 100 nodes - node size proportional to node degree

# Load the igraph library
library(igraph)

# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(42)

# Create a sample network using preferential attachment model
g <- barabasi.game(n = 100, power = 1, m = 2, directed = FALSE)

# Calculate node properties
degree_centrality <- degree(g)
betweenness_centrality <- betweenness(g)

# Create a green to magenta color palette based on degree centrality
green_to_magenta <- colorRampPalette(c("#B3B4B4", "#EC49FF"))(max(degree_centrality))
node_colors <- green_to_magenta[degree_centrality]

# Set node sizes based on betweenness centrality
node_sizes <- 5 + (betweenness_centrality / max(betweenness_centrality)) * 25

# Set transparent background
par(bg = NA)

# Create the visualization
plot(g, 
     vertex.color = node_colors,
     vertex.size = node_sizes,
     vertex.label = NA,
     edge.width = 0.5,
     edge.color = rgb(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.3),
     layout = layout_with_fr(g),
     )
```
